result.execSummary:
The defendant Davairian L. Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 1 day, if revoked.
Expunction hrg set for 2/4/16 @ 830am.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with drug dealers or felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.
Huber allowed.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

As an Alternative to Revocation (ATR) - Order signed 8/7/15 - As a Condition of Probation.
Credit since the 7/29/15 order to detain.
Huber for employment and treatment IS allowed.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; 6 months conditional jail w/Huber privileges is stayed; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; credit for one day served if revoked.  Expunction hearing set for 2/4/16 at 8:30am.  Court amends the record to show the deft's first name is spelled Davairian.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, the enhancer on or near a school is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 11/3/14 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Komp states the deft does intend to accept the State's offer but is requesting more time before entering a plea.  PLEAS set for 9/2/14 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.
Executed search warrant filed on 2-24-14 transfered from 14GF4000X KPD 2014-020774
Angela Komp

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Bennett.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, PLEAS continued to 7/24/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Bennett.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bennett states the case will be settled.  PLEAH set for 5/28/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
NO RECORD MADE.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Bennett.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  FPT adjourned to 4/29/14 at 9am.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
with Atty Bennett the FPT of 4/7/14 at 2pm is rescheduled, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar; reset to 4/8/14 at 8:30am.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Bennett.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bennett acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  FPT 4/7/14 at 2pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Chuck Bennett. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Burgoyne. Prelim. waived,  probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 3-19-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
C Bennett
